[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 149]
Reasoning: **Current Round Decision: Let's Get This Show on the Road**

Okay, so I'm in the `BLIND_SELECT` phase for the Boss Blind of Ante 5, facing "The Mark," which means any cards I draw *after* a hand is played are flipped face down. I need 22,000 chips, and I have a $5 reward on the line. I'm sitting on $29, but that's not the priority right now.

My inventory is as follows: Gros Michel (a solid +15 Mult), Egg (which sells for some cash), Droll Joker (essential for Flushes, +10 Mult and x1.5 Mult), Perkeo (my consumable-duplicating friend), and Blue Joker (the chips-giver, currently +94). I also have two copies of "The Moon," which can convert three cards to Clubs, courtesy of Perkeo.

I'm ready to play, and the command to start the round, `play_round`, is available. The available commands are: `"play_round", "use_consumable", "sell_consumable", "rearrange_jokers", "sell_joker"`. Before hitting `play_round`, I need to make sure I'm positioned for success.

First, the Joker order. Gros Michel's additive Mult should be at the top of the list, followed by Droll Joker. This ensures the calculation (Base + 15 + 10) * 1.5. Egg and Perkeo don't directly impact scoring, and Blue Joker is purely chip-based, so its position doesn't matter for the multiplicative Jokers. The current order is fine.

I can't use "The Moon" right now as I am still in Blind Select.

The round has to start. There is no reason to sell or rearrange.

I know from previous rounds that I can probably hit around 10k chips per Flush with my current build. So, I'm aiming for two Flushes to hit the 22k target for the Boss. The "The Mark" Boss makes things interesting. The boss text is, "Cards drawn face down after each hand played", which affects me after each hand.

Considering the "The Mark" boss effect, my strategy will be as follows: use discards to find those clubs, and set up a solid first hand. The new cards drawn after the first hand *will* be face down. Since discards are safe, I should use those to set up my Flushes. I want to win in as few hands as possible.

I'm checking: Gros Michel (15), Egg (37), Droll (10 + x1.5), Perkeo, Blue Joker (+ Chips).
The order is correct. It's time.

I will `play_round`.



Command: play_round

Reasoning: **The Plan: Flush for the Win (and Hopefully, Perfection)**

Okay, here's the situation. I'm staring down The Mark, need a hefty 11,920 more chips to hit the 22,000 target, and I've only got three hands left. This means I need to maximize my scoring potential. My mind immediately gravitates towards Flushes – they're my bread and butter. I've got a decent setup with the Gros Michel and Droll Joker bonuses, so a good Flush could get me close.

The Boss effect, though, that's the kicker – face-down cards after a hand. But wait, after a discard? That's the real question. Let's see... *re-reads boss* "Cards drawn face down after *each hand played*." Aha! The phrasing is key. It doesn't mention discards. That gives me an idea.

I've got a hand with a 3 of Clubs and five face-down cards. And *two* "The Moon" cards. I've also got the Blue Joker (chips) and the other Jokers (Mult). I want to play to the strength of the deck, which is heavily skewed towards Clubs (24/34 cards).

My initial instinct was to burn the "The Moons" to *guarantee* a Flush by turning non-Clubs into Clubs. But then I have an epiphany: I've got 4 discards. I should discard the face-down cards. Wait... no, I should discard the *non-Clubs* first. That should give me a better chance of drawing face-up Clubs. *Double checks the rules* Yes, the Boss' effect only triggers on hands played.

Why didn't I think of this sooner? Instead of locking into the "The Moon" strategy immediately, I have a more elegant option. If I discard the two non-Clubs (the 8 of Diamonds and 2 of Diamonds), the replacement cards will be FACE UP! Then I can either use the "The Moon", or play the hand as is (discarding the faces if need be).

Actually... why not discard ALL the face-down cards? If I discard *all* face-down cards, I get a whole new hand, *completely* face-up, and can pick and choose the best Clubs to go for a Flush. This is it. Discard all the face-down cards.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

reasoning:
**My Strategy for "The Mark" Boss Blind: Flush and Discard**

Okay, here's the situation: Ante 5, Round 14, and I need to get 22,000 chips. I'm currently at 10,080, so I need 11,920 more with only 3 hands left. The "Mark" boss flips cards face down *after* each hand, but crucially, discards don't flip cards.

I have some powerful Jokers: Gros Michel for Mult, Egg (sell value), Droll (more Mult for Flush), Perkeo (negative consumables), and a Blue Joker for chips. I have two "Moon" consumables, good for turning cards into clubs, and Flush is at level 4. The current hand is a possible Club Flush (King, Queen, 6, 3, 3) which is worth a solid 8,925 chips, with the Droll Joker's Polychrome edition giving a x1.5 modifier.

Originally, I thought of using "The Moon" to improve the Flush further, converting the Diamonds to Clubs. But then I realized, this first hand with the Flush has to be played. The next hand is going to be partially face-down. So, the right strategy is to play the flush hand (for 8,925 chips), discard to fish for good cards on the next hand, then play the next hand, and so on.

However, I have 3 discards and 3 hands. I can't win in 1 hand (need 11.9k, max is ~10k), and the second hand will likely have face-down cards. The strategy is now clear: Play a Flush now to take advantage of the current cards. Then, for the next hand, if cards are face down, use "The Moon" or discards to find the next Flush. The Blue Joker is going to get weaker as the deck gets smaller, so it's a priority to use it now.

Calculating: Playing the Club Flush (King, Queen, 6, 3, 3), that's 80 (Flush Lvl 4) + 58 (Blue) + 32 (card total) = 170 chips, multiplied by (10 + 15 + 10) * 1.5 = 52.5 mult, for a total of 8,925 chips. That's a solid start.

The real key here is maximizing what I can do with discards, given the face-down card mechanic. So, I will play the Flush, bank those chips, then focus on improving the second hand using my remaining discards and "The Moon" consumable, if needed. Then I can make sure I have enough chips to get through the boss.

So, the play is to use my current Flush hand.
